page.title: 06Stratton Manor Moat.
page.content: The moat is situated just to the east of the entrance to Stratton Park Drive. It marks the site of the original manor house of Stratton. In early times Stratton was far more important than Biggleswade. There is evidence of an early Romano-British road between Baldock and Sandy which passed next to the site of the moat. It was not until the late thirteenth-early fourteenth century that Stratton House was built. The last manor house on this site was pulled down in 1959. At the present time the moat is about three quarters complete. It is crossed by a built up causeway. On either side of this the moat is filled in with silt and rubbish. There are no visible signs of buildings within the moat but a dig in the 1950's showed evidence offoundations and walls.
